p: 11. The limitations of these sciences. We are not passing judgment on the positive achievements of anthropology, psychology, and biology. We are merely suggesting that they cannot answer the question about the being of human beings. We cannot get to the ontological foundations of ex-sistence by way of hypotheses derived from empirical material, because even if one does that, presuppositions about the being of human beings are already operative before we collect the empirical material, despite the fact that positive-scientific research overlooks them.9
